subject: Management
title: Mergers and Culture Clash
description: Learn Mergers and Culture Clash in one minute.

hook.text: Daimler-Chrysler merged in 1998. By 2007 they split. Culture clash destroyed $36 billion in value.

buildup.text: Most mergers focus on financials. Culture compatibility is an afterthought. It shouldn't be.

discovery.text: Research shows 70-90% of mergers fail. Culture clash is the number one cited reason.

twist.text: Two successful cultures combined don't make a super-culture. They often make chaos.

climax.text: Assess cultural compatibility before any merger. Define which practices from each will survive.

punchline.text: Merge the balance sheets easily. Merging cultures is the hard part.

quiz.question: Why do most mergers fail?
options: Culture clash between the two organizations is the top cited reason
The financial models are always wrong
Employees always resist any organizational change
